soc.client

Class SOCPlayerClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.client.SOCPlayerClient

  • public class SOCPlayerClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer. (For applet see SOCApplet.) The main user interface class SwingMainDisplay prompts for name and password, then connects and displays the lists of games and channels available. An actual game is played in a separate SOCPlayerInterface window.

    If you want another connection port, you have to specify it as the "port" argument in the html source. If you run this as a stand-alone, the port can be specified on the command line or typed into SwingMainDisplay's connect dialog.

    At startup or init, will try to connect to server via ClientNetwork#connect(String, int). See that method for more details.

    There are three possible servers to which a client can be connected:

    • A remote server, running on the other end of a TCP connection
    • A local TCP server, for hosting games, launched by this client: ClientNetwork#localTCPServer
    • A "practice game" server, not bound to any TCP port, for practicing locally against robots: ClientNetwork#practiceServer launched by #startPracticeGame()
    A running client can be connected to at most one TCP server at a time, plus the practice server. Its single shared list of games shows those on the server and any practice games. Each game's SOCGame#isPractice flag determines which connection to use.

    Once connected, messages from the server are processed in MessageHandler#handle(SOCMessage, boolean).

    Messages to the server are formed and sent using GameMessageSender.

    If network trouble or applet shutdown occurs, calls shutdownFromNetwork(); may still be able to play practice games locally.

    Author:
    Robert S Thomas

    • Field Detail

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLEAR__PREFS

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLEAR__PREFS
        String property jsettlers.debug.clear_prefs to support testing and debugging: When present, at startup this list of persistent client Preferences keys will be removed: The SOCPlayerClient constructor will call UserPreferences.clear(String).

        Format: String of comma-separated preference key names: PREF_PI__WIDTH, PREF_SOUND_ON, PREF_BOT_TRADE_REJECT_SEC, PREF_HEX_GRAPHICS_SET, etc.

        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_FEATURES

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_FEATURES
        String property jsettlers.debug.client.features to support server testing and debugging: When present, client will report these Client Features to server in its Version message instead of its actual features from SOCFeatureSet.CLIENT_*.

        Format: Empty for none, or string of semicolon-surrounded client features: ";6pl;sb;"
        Same format as SOCFeatureSet.getEncodedList().

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_GAMEOPT3P, Constant Field Values

      • PREF_PI__WIDTH

        public static final java.lang.String PREF_PI__WIDTH
        Integer persistent Preferences key for width of a SOCPlayerInterface window frame, based on most recent resizing by user. Used with PREF_PI__HEIGHT.

        For games with 6 players and/or the sea board, a scaling factor is applied to this preference to keep consistent window sizes and width/height ratios.

        If high-DPI mode (SOCPlayerInterface.displayScale > 1) this preference is divided by displayScale when stored. That prevents sizing problems if user changes their screen resolution later which changes the displayScale computed at startup.

        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PREF_PI__HEIGHT

        public static final java.lang.String PREF_PI__HEIGHT
        Integer persistent Preferences key for height of a SOCPlayerInterface window frame; see PREF_PI__WIDTH for details.
        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PREF_SOUND_ON

        public static final java.lang.String PREF_SOUND_ON
        Boolean persistent Preferences key for sound effects. Default value is true.

        To set this value for a new SOCPlayerInterface, use SOCPlayerInterface.PREF_SOUND_MUTE as the key within its localPrefs map.

        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        UserPreferences.getPref(String, boolean), SOCPlayerInterface.isSoundMuted(), Constant Field Values

      • PREF_BOT_TRADE_REJECT_SEC

        public static final java.lang.String PREF_BOT_TRADE_REJECT_SEC
        Integer persistent Preferences key for starting value of the countdown to auto-reject bot trades, in seconds. Negative if auto-reject is disabled, to keep the setting's value for NewGameOptionsFrame and "Options" dialogs without also having a separate enabled/disabled flag.

        Default value is -8. Do not store 0.

        This key name can be used with the SOCPlayerInterface constructor's localPrefs map during game setup. If negative there, auto-reject will be disabled until turned on from that PI's "Options" button.

        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        UserPreferences.getPref(String, int), SOCPlayerInterface.getBotTradeRejectSec(), Constant Field Values

      • PREF_HEX_GRAPHICS_SET

        public static final java.lang.String PREF_HEX_GRAPHICS_SET
        Integer persistent Preferences key for choice of hex graphics set.
        • 0 or missing: Default set: Pastel, added in v2.0.00
        • 1: Classic set, from v1.x.xx
        • Any other value: Default set
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        UserPreferences.getPref(String, int), Constant Field Values

      • PREF_UI_SCALE_FORCE

        public static final java.lang.String PREF_UI_SCALE_FORCE
        Integer persistent Preferences optional key to force (2 or 3) or disable (1) UI Scaling. Negative if disabled, to keep the setting's value for NewGameOptionsFrame and "Options" dialogs without also having a separate enabled/disabled flag.

        Default value is 0 (unused). Ignored if above 3.

        When determining MainDisplay.getDisplayScaleFactor() at startup, Is overridden if command-line JVM property SwingMainDisplay.PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_SCALE is used. That in turn is overridden for a new game if preference value is changed in game's NewGameOptionsFrame.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        UserPreferences.getPref(String, int), Constant Field Values

      • PREF_FACE_ICON

        public static final java.lang.String PREF_FACE_ICON
        Integer persistent Preferences key for remembering preferred face icon ID. Default value is 1 (default face ID from previous versions). See SOCPlayer.setFaceId(int) for face ID value range.
        • Positive: Remember this face ID, use it by default when starting client. Previous versions always defaulted to SOCPlayer.FIRST_HUMAN_FACE_ID (1).
        • Negative or 0: Don't use this remembered value as default face ID.
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        UserPreferences.getPref(String, int), Constant Field Values

      • IS_PLATFORM_MAC_OSX

        public static final boolean IS_PLATFORM_MAC_OSX

        Before v2.0.00 this field was isJavaOnOSX.

        Since:
        1.1.07

        Since:

        See Also:
        IS_PLATFORM_MAC_OSX

      • cliLocale

        final java.util.Locale cliLocale
        Locale for i18n message lookups used for strings. Also sent to server while connecting. Override if needed in the constructor by reading JVM property PROP_JSETTLERS_LOCALE ("jsettlers.locale").
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • sFeatures

        protected SOCFeatureSet sFeatures
        Server's active optional features, sent soon after connect, or null if unknown. Not used with a local practice server, so always check SOCGame#isPractice before checking this field.
        Since:
        1.1.19
        See Also:
        #tcpServGameOpts

      • serverGameOptions

        protected final ServerGametypeInfo serverGameOptions
        Track the game options available at the remote server. Initialized by MessageHandler.handleGAMEOPTIONGETDEFAULTS(SOCGameOptionGetDefaults, Connection) and MessageHandler.handleGAMEOPTIONINFO(SOCGameOptionInfo). These fields are never null, but may be empty.

        For a summary of the flags and variables involved with game options, and the client/server interaction about their values, see ServerGametypeInfo's javadoc.

        Scenario strings are localized by #localizeGameScenarios(List, boolean, boolean, boolean).

        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        sFeatures

      • DEFAULT_PRACTICE_GAMENAME

        public final java.lang.String DEFAULT_PRACTICE_GAMENAME
        For practice games, default game name ("Practice"). Set in constructor using i18n strings lookup.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • nickname

        protected java.lang.String nickname
        Client nickname as a player; null until validated and set by SwingMainDisplay.getValidNickname(boolean). Returned by #getNickname(boolean).

      • password

        protected java.lang.String password
        the password for nickname from #pass, or null if no valid password yet. May be empty (""). If server has authenticated this password, the gotPassword flag is set.

      • gotPassword

        protected boolean gotPassword
        true if we've stored the password and the server's replied that it's correct.
        See Also:
        isNGOFWaitingForAuthStatus

      • isNGOFWaitingForAuthStatus

        protected boolean isNGOFWaitingForAuthStatus
        true if user clicked "new game" and, before showing NewGameOptionsFrame, we've sent the nickname (username) and password to the server and are waiting for a response.

        Used only with TCP servers, not with ClientNetwork#practiceServer.

        Since:
        1.1.19

      • debugTraffic

        boolean debugTraffic
        True if contents of incoming and outgoing network message traffic should be debug-printed. Set if optional system property SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_TRAFFIC is set.

        Versions earlier than 1.1.20 always printed this debug output; 1.1.20 never prints it.

        Since:
        1.2.00

      • lastFaceChange

        protected int lastFaceChange
        Face icon ID chosen most recently (for use in new games) for SOCPlayer.setFaceId(int); always >= SOCPlayer.FIRST_HUMAN_FACE_ID. Persisted to client pref PREF_FACE_ICON by SOCPlayerInterface window listener's windowClosed(..).
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • games

        protected java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,SOCGame> games
        All the games we're currently playing. Includes networked or hosted games and those on practice server. Accessed from GUI thread and network MessageHandler thread.
        See Also:
        serverGames

      • serverGames

        protected SOCGameList serverGames
        all announced game names on the remote server, including games which we can't join due to limitations of the client. May also contain options for all announced games on the server (not just ones we're in) which we can join (version is not higher than our version).

        Key is the game name, without the UNJOINABLE prefix. This field is null until handleGAMES, handleGAMESWITHOPTIONS, handleNEWGAME or handleNEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS is called.

        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        games, gamesUnjoinableOverride

      • gamesUnjoinableOverride

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> gamesUnjoinableOverride
        the unjoinable game names from serverGames that player has asked to join, and been told they can't. If they click again, try to connect. (This is a failsafe against bugs in server or client version-recognition.) Both key and value are the game name, without the GAMENAME_PREFIX_CANNOT_JOIN prefix.
        Since:
        1.1.06

      • ignoreList

        protected java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> ignoreList
        the ignore list

      • numPracticeGames

        protected int numPracticeGames
        Number of practice games started; used for naming practice games
        Since:
        1.1.00

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCPlayerClient

        public SOCPlayerClient()
        Create a SOCPlayerClient connecting to localhost port ClientNetwork.SOC_PORT_DEFAULT. Initializes helper objects (except MainDisplay), locale, SOCStringManager. The locale will be the current user's default locale, unless overridden by setting the PROP_JSETTLERS_LOCALE JVM property "jsettlers.locale".

        Must call SOCApplet#init(), or setMainDisplay(MainDisplay) and then MainDisplay.initVisualElements(), to start up and do layout.

        Must then call connect(String, int, String, String) or ClientNetwork#connect(String, int) to join a TCP server, or MainDisplay.clickPracticeButton() or MainDisplay.startLocalTCPServer(int) to start a server locally.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String chost,
                    int cport,
                    java.lang.String cuser,
                    java.lang.String cpass)
        Connect and give feedback by showing MESSAGE_PANEL. Calls MainDisplay.connect(String, String) to set username and password, then ClientNetwork#connect(String, int) to make the connection.
        Parameters:
        chost - Hostname to connect to, or null for localhost
        cport - Port number to connect to
        cuser - User nickname
        cpass - User optional password
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • reloadBoardGraphics

        void reloadBoardGraphics()
        Flush and reload the set of hex graphics currently selected in user preference PREF_HEX_GRAPHICS_SET. Redraw board in all game interfaces: Calls each one's PlayerClientListener.boardUpdated() in the UI thread.

        Call if the user picks a different hex graphics set (using NewGameOptionsFrame), which affects all SOCPlayerInterfaces.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • wantsI18nStrings

        final boolean wantsI18nStrings(boolean isPractice)
        Should this client request localized strings (I18N) from the server if available? Checks server version, checks whether client locale differs from the fallback "en_US".
        Parameters:
        isPractice - True if checking for local practice server, not a remote server
        Returns:
        True if client should request localized strings
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • checkGameoptsForUnknownScenario

        protected void checkGameoptsForUnknownScenario(SOCGameOptionSet opts)
        Check these game options to see if they contain a scenario we don't yet have full info about. If the options include a scenario and we don't have that scenario's info or localized strings, ask the server for that but don't wait here for a reply.

        Do not call for practice games: Assumes this is the TCP server, because for practice games we already have full info about scenarios and their strings.

        Parameters:
        opts - Game options to check for "SC", or null
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • localizeGameScenarios

        protected void localizeGameScenarios(java.util.List<java.lang.String> scStrs,
                                     boolean skipFirst,
                                     boolean sentAll)
        Localize SOCScenario names and descriptions with strings from the server. Updates scenario data in #practiceServGameOpts or #tcpServGameOpts: Add each scenario in scStrs, add its keyname to ServerGametypeInfo.scenKeys, and call SOCScenario.setDesc(String, String) unless it's marked as SOCLocalizedStrings.MARKER_KEY_UNKNOWN within scStrs.
        Parameters:
        scStrs - Scenario localized strings, same format as SOCLocalizedStrings params.
        skipFirst - If true skip the first element of scStrs, it isn't a scenario keyname.
        sentAll - True if no further strings will be received; is SOCLocalizedStrings.FLAG_SENT_ALL set? If true, sets ServerGametypeInfo.allScenStringsReceived.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • doesGameExist

        public boolean doesGameExist(java.lang.String gameName)
        Does a game with this name exist, either at the remote server or our local Server (if one is running)?
        Parameters:
        gameName - Game name to check. Should not have the prefix SOCGames.MARKER_THIS_GAME_UNJOINABLE.
        Returns:
        True if game exists in client's server game lists
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • addToGameList

        public void addToGameList(java.lang.String gameName,
                          java.lang.String gameOptsStr,
                          boolean addToSrvList)
        Add a new game to the initial window's list of games, and possibly to the server games list.
        Parameters:
        gameName - the game name to add to the list; may have the prefix SOCGames.MARKER_THIS_GAME_UNJOINABLE
        gameOptsStr - String of packed game options, or null
        addToSrvList - Should this game be added to the list of remote-server games? Practice games should not be added. The serverGames list also has a flag for cannotJoin.
        See Also:
        #doesGameExist(String, boolean), MainDisplay.addToGameList(boolean, String, String, boolean)

      • updateGameEndStats

        public void updateGameEndStats(java.lang.String game,
                               int[] scores)
        If we're playing in or observing a game that's just finished, update the scores. This is used to show the true scores, including hidden victory-point cards, at the game's end.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • leaveChannel

        public void leaveChannel(java.lang.String ch)
        the user leaves the given chat channel
        Parameters:
        ch - the name of the channel

      • onIgnoreList

        protected boolean onIgnoreList(java.lang.String name)
        Returns:
        true if name is on the ignore list

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • startPracticeServer

        public void startPracticeServer()

      • startPracticeGame

        public boolean startPracticeGame(java.lang.String practiceGameName,
                                 SOCGameOptionSet gameOpts,
                                 boolean mainPanelIsActive)
        Setup for practice game (on the non-tcp server). If needed, a (stringport, not tcp) ClientNetwork#practiceServer, client, and robots are started.
        Parameters:
        practiceGameName - Unique name to give practice game; if name unknown, call #startPracticeGame() instead
        gameOpts - Set of game options to use, or null
        mainPanelIsActive - Is the SOCPlayerClient main panel active? False if we're being called from elsewhere, such as SOCConnectOrPracticePanel.
        Returns:
        True if the practice game request was sent, false if there was a problem starting the practice server or client
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • getNextGameName

        public java.lang.String getNextGameName()

      • putGameReqLocalPrefs

        void putGameReqLocalPrefs(java.lang.String gaName,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> localPrefs)
        For new-game requests, a per-game local preference map from NewGameOptionsFrame to pass to that new game's SOCPlayerInterface constructor.

        Preference name keys are SOCPlayerInterface.PREF_SOUND_MUTE, etc. Values for boolean prefs should be Boolean.TRUE or .FALSE.

        The HashMap of game names permits a null value instead of a Map, but there is no guarantee that preference values can be null within a game's Map.

        Parameters:
        gaName - Game name
        localPrefs - Local prefs to store for gaName
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        getGameReqLocalPrefs()

      • getServerVersion

        public int getServerVersion(SOCGame game)
        Server version, for checking feature availability. Returns -1 if unknown. Checks SOCGame#isPractice: practice games always return this client's own Version.versionNumber().

        Instead of calling this method, some client code checks a game's version like:
        (game.isPractice || (client.sVersion >= VERSION_FOR_AUTHREQUEST))

        Parameters:
        game - Game being played on a practice or tcp server.
        Returns:
        Server version, in same format as Version.versionNumber(), or 0 or -1.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • putLeaveAll

        boolean putLeaveAll()
        For shutdown - Tell the server we're leaving all games. If we've started a practice server, also tell that server. If we've started a TCP server, tell all players on that server, and shut it down.

        Since no other state variables are set, call this only right before discarding this object or calling System.exit.

        Returns:
        Can we still start practice games? (No local exception yet in #ex_P)
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • shutdownFromNetwork

        public void shutdownFromNetwork()
        network trouble; if possible, ask if they want to play locally (practiceServer vs. robots). Otherwise, go ahead and shut down. Either way, calls MainDisplay.showErrorPanel(String, boolean) to show an error message or network exception detail. Removes server's games and channels from MainDisplay's lists.

        "If possible" is determined from return value of ClientNetwork#putLeaveAll().

        Before v1.2.01 this method was destroy().
